subject: Re: [junit] Unit Testing question
msgSnippet: ... I can t discern whether that is a compliment. ... Quite right. Programmer Tests are whatever tests I need, as a programmer, to be confident that my code
messageBody:
Simon Chappell wrote:

> I'll get the first shot in and then hide while the mighty J.B. strides
> down from atop of his mountain to correct us all. ;-)

I can't discern whether that is a compliment.

> Perhaps this is why J.B. prefers the term "programmer tests" instead
> of unit tests. Because no one can agree on what a unit actually is,
> but most programmers know what needs to be tested.

Quite right. Programmer Tests are whatever tests I need, as a
programmer, to be confident that my code does what I think I asked it to
do. Object Tests, which test one object at a time, are usually
Programmer Tests. Some Integration Tests are Programmer Tests.

If you want to know more, you know which book to buy. (Hint: read my .sig)

> OK, everyone else gets a turn now.

This ought to be fun.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
